Package magellan.library.gamebinding

Interface MapMetric

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AtlantisMapMetric, EresseaMapMetric
    public interface MapMetric
    A map metric handles the properties of a coordinate system, mainly that of directions mapping to coordinates and vice versa.
    Author:
    stm

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      BoxTransformer.BBox createBBox()
      Returns a bounding box suited for this coordinate system.
      int getDifference​(Direction from, Direction to)
      Returns the difference to the specified directions.
      Direction getDirection​(CoordinateID from, CoordinateID to)
      Returns the direction from a coordinate to an adjacent coordinate.
      Direction getDirection​(Region from, Region to)
      Returns the direction from a coordinate to an adjacent coordinate.
      java.util.List<Direction> getDirections()
      Returns a list of all directions, sorted by ascending direction code.
      Direction opposite​(Direction d)
      Returns the direction opposite to d.
      Direction toDirection​(int dirCode)
      Returns the direction for an internal direction code.
      CoordinateID translate​(CoordinateID c, Direction direction)
      Returns the coordinate that is adjacent to c in the specified direction.

    • Method Detail

      • getDirection

        Direction getDirection​(CoordinateID from,
                       CoordinateID to)
        Returns the direction from a coordinate to an adjacent coordinate.
        Returns:
        The corresponding direction, Direction.INVALID if from and to are not adjacent.

      • getDirection

        Direction getDirection​(Region from,
                       Region to)
        Returns the direction from a coordinate to an adjacent coordinate.
        Returns:
        The corresponding direction, Direction.INVALID if from and to are not adjacent.

      • toDirection

        Direction toDirection​(int dirCode)
        Returns the direction for an internal direction code.
        See Also:
        Direction.getDirCode()

      • getDirections

        java.util.List<Direction> getDirections()
        Returns a list of all directions, sorted by ascending direction code.

      • opposite

        Direction opposite​(Direction d)
        Returns the direction opposite to d.

      • translate

        CoordinateID translate​(CoordinateID c,
                       Direction direction)
        Returns the coordinate that is adjacent to c in the specified direction.
        Returns:
        The translated coordinate, CoordinateID.INVALID if direction == Direction.INVALID

      • getDifference

        int getDifference​(Direction from,
                  Direction to)
        Returns the difference to the specified directions. E.g., getDifference(NE, W) == -2 , getDifference(NE, SE) == 2, getDifference(NE, SW) == 3. Differences to Direction.INVALID are always Integer.MAX_VALUE.

      • createBBox

        BoxTransformer.BBox createBBox()
        Returns a bounding box suited for this coordinate system.
